intro: Oenone othmeri, commonly known as the mountain oenone, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Oenone othmeri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
